markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Minimum 1.6m x 2.2m accessible toilet compartment (2) Grab rail positions per AS 1428.1 (3) Adequate circulation space for wheelchair turning (4) Basin and fixture heights per accessibility standards.

stem_or_prompt: On a reinforced concrete suspended slab plan for a Class 5 building, show typical reinforcement layout including main bars, distribution bars, starter bars at columns, and additional reinforcement at openings. Indicate typical spacing.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Main reinforcement in both directions (2) Appropriate spacing per structural design (3) Additional bars around penetrations (4) Starter bars at column connections (5) Understanding AS 3600 reinforcement detailing requirements.

stem_or_prompt: On a site plan showing a Class 6 building 2 metres from the side boundary, indicate what fire resistance is required for the external wall. Show any restrictions on openings (windows, doors) in this wall.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Understanding fire resistance requirements based on distance to boundary (2) Limited or no openings when closer than 3m to boundary (3) Appropriate FRL for external wall (4) Reference to NCC boundary fire protection provisions.

stem_or_prompt: On a multi-level retail plan (Class 6), show accessible paths of travel from the entry to all public areas on two levels. Indicate where ramps, lifts, or platform lifts are required, and show compliant gradients.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Continuous accessible paths to all public areas (2) Ramp gradients not exceeding 1:8 (3) Lift or platform lift connecting levels (4) Minimum 1000mm width for accessible paths.

stem_or_prompt: On a section through an excavation for basement construction, show temporary shoring or retention system required for 4m deep excavation adjacent to an existing building. Indicate monitoring points for adjacent structure.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Appropriate retention system (soldier piles, sheet piling, etc.) (2) Adequate design for 4m depth and lateral loads (3) Protection of adjacent building (4) Monitoring points on existing structure (5) Understanding temporary works engineering requirements.

stem_or_prompt: On a floor plan showing fire compartment walls and fire-isolated stairs in a Class 5 building, mark all locations where fire doors are required. Indicate whether doors should be self-closing or automatic closing.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Fire doors at all penetrations of fire-rated walls (2) Fire doors at stairway entries (3) Understanding self-closing requirements (4) Appropriate FRL ratings for doors matching walls.

stem_or_prompt: On a plan of a large Class 8 warehouse building 100m long, show where structural expansion joints should be located in the steel framing. Indicate typical joint details and spacing between joints.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Expansion joints at appropriate intervals (typically 40-80m) (2) Understanding thermal movement requirements (3) Joints allowing independent movement (4) Coordination with roof and wall systems (5) Structural engineering principles for long buildings.

stem_or_prompt: For a Class 9b assembly building (theater) with 400 seat capacity, calculate and show the required number of exits and their locations. Demonstrate compliance with NCC travel distance and exit distribution requirements for places of public assembly.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Minimum number of exits based on occupancy (typically 4 exits for 400 people) (2) Exit distribution around perimeter (3) Travel distance compliance (typically 20m maximum for Class 9b) (4) Aggregate exit width calculation (5) Understanding special egress requirements for assembly buildings.

stem_or_prompt: On a floor plan of a Class 6 retail building with deep tenancies lacking external walls, show how mechanical ventilation can be provided. Indicate ductwork zones, air handling unit locations, and required air changes.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Central or distributed AHU locations (2) Supply and return air ductwork distribution (3) Understanding AS 1668.2 ventilation requirements (4) Adequate air changes for retail occupancy.

stem_or_prompt: On a warehouse plan 60m x 40m, design an efficient tilt-up panel layout. Show panel sizes, locations, pour areas on slab, and indicate where panels will be lifted and tilted into position. Consider practical panel sizes and crane reach.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Practical panel sizes (typically 3-4m wide, not exceeding 7-8m high) (2) Panels poured on slab in logical sequence (3) Adequate space for tilting (4) Crane positioning and reach considerations (5) Understanding practical tilt-up construction methodology.

stem_or_prompt: On a roof plan for a commercial building under construction, show fall protection systems required for roof work. Indicate perimeter edge protection, safety mesh or catch platforms, and any anchor points for personal fall arrest systems.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Perimeter edge protection (guardrails) (2) Safety mesh at purlin level during sheeting (3) Anchor points for harnesses where edge protection not feasible (4) Understanding hierarchy of fall protection controls.

stem_or_prompt: On a site plan showing two separate Class 5 buildings on one allotment, 8 metres apart, indicate what fire separation requirements (if any) apply between the buildings. Show any required FRL for facing walls and restrictions on openings.
markingGuideline: Award marks for: (1) Understanding buildings on same allotment may be treated as united or separate (2) If treated separately, fire separation based on distance (3) Understanding reduced FRL and opening restrictions for buildings 6m+ apart (4) Correct application of NCC boundary fire provisions (5) Understanding fire wall requirements if buildings are united.
